Definition:  In Person
In person
, when referring to a hearing, means that hearing participants/attendees are
present in the same physical space, or
not in the same physical space but are in the same virtual space, able to see and hear one another, and interact as if they were physically together.
Reference
:  For more information on the right to an in person hearing, see
38 CFR 3.103(d)
.
